title: Replace Pronouns with Placeholders in Outcome Comments
description: Add 'Replace Pronouns with Placeholders' button to Outcome Comments Modal with code reuse from personalized comments implementation

complexity.reasoning: Micro feature: 4 user stories, 1-2 weeks effort, single team, code reuse from existing implementation (BulkUploadModal), no new API endpoints, client-side only, moderate UI additions

primary_deliverables: Replace Pronouns button in OutcomeCommentsModal (add and edit modes)
Reusable button component or hook for code reuse
Functional pronoun replacement with user feedback
Comprehensive test coverage for new functionality
constraints: Must match existing button behavior in BulkUploadModal
No changes to backend or API
out_of_scope: Changes to Pronoun API or backend
UI redesign of outcome comments modal
Changes to other modals or components

business_value.user_problem: Teachers must manually replace hard-coded pronouns in outcome comments to make them personalizable, while the feature is readily available in bulk upload
business_value.impact: Consistency and flexibility in outcome comments, same user experience across comment creation interfaces
success_metrics: Button appears and is functional in outcome comments
Zero regressions in existing outcome comments functionality
Code reuse: â‰¥50% reduction in replace-pronouns related duplication
Users can replace pronouns with same experience as bulk upload

technical_approach.implementation_notes: Study PersonalizedCommentsModal as architectural guide (more similar modal structure). Extract replace pronouns button UI logic into reusable component (ReplacePronounsButton) or hook (useReplacePronounsFunctionality) that can be used across PersonalizedCommentsModal, BulkUploadModal, and OutcomeCommentsModal.

risks.risk: Code extraction creates maintenance burden if UI changes needed
risks.mitigation: Create comprehensive tests that define component behavior, making changes easier to validate

risks.risk: OutcomeCommentsModal doesn't have easy access to pronouns
risks.mitigation: Pass pronouns as prop from parent component or use context/hooks

notes: L1 feature - straightforward UI addition with code reuse from existing implementation. Ready for implementation after product approval.
